articles.title: Bitcoin ETFs Hit by Record Outflows as Gold ETFs Surge
articles.author: Sumit Roy
articles.summary: Investors withdrew $750 million from U.S.-listed spot bitcoin ETFs on Wednesday. It's the worst period of outflows since their launch a year ago. The iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) was up 1% year to date as recently as Feb. 20, but it's now down more than 13%. iShares Etherum Trust (ETHA) is down 33%. articles.summary: BitMEX, the once-dominant crypto trading platform, is officially on the market. Founded by Arthur Hayes in 2014, BitMEX's journey has been a rollercoaster marked by both meteoric rise and regulatory headwinds. Now, it appears the platform is officially available.

articles.title: Revolutionary Sonic Mobius Mainnet Unleashes Solana Layer-2 Scalability
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: Sonic, a project in the Solana ecosystem, has officially launched its Mobius mainnet. This launch promises to address some of the pressing issues for the network and its users. It is a significant leap forward in scalability and efficiency for the system.

articles.title: SHELL Token Boom: Crypto Whale Dumps Holdings on Binance for $1M Profit!
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: A major investor made a huge deposit in the SHELL token market after Binance, a leading crypto exchange, listed SHELL. The investor is often referred to as a 'whale' in the crypto-world of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. He is a savvy investor.

articles.title: How DeepSeek succeeded
articles.author: Chen Song
articles.summary: DeepSeek is a Chinese technology firm specialising in advanced AI models. Its latest model has been adopted by major internet platforms within two weeks of its launch. The success of DeepSeek in the world stems from China's enduring commitment to innovation. China's total investment in scientific and technological research and development ranks second globally, and it has become the global 'quadruple champion'.

articles.title: Foreign Fraud Syndicates Establishing Cybercrime Cells In Nigeria, EFCC Chairman Warns
articles.summary: EFCC Chairman, Ola Olukoyede, has expressed concern over the growing presence of foreign fraud syndicates in Nigeria. They are establishing cybercrime cells and recruiting young Nigerians into organised financial crimes, including cryptocurrency fraud. They may be using cryptocurrency to facilitate the illegal importation of arms into Nigeria. Some of the arrested foreigners were ex-convicts in their home countries who had fled to Africa.

articles.title: France joining the U.S. in seeking access to Ukraine's minerals; says it's in talks
articles.author: RAF CASERT
articles.summary: FBI accuses North Korean-backed hackers of stealing $1.5 billion in crypto from Dubai-based firm. The company was hacked by a group backed by North Korean hackers.   .   in the last few days, the company has been hacked.
